alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:32PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Uintah County through 700 PM MDT... At 632 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vernal, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vernal, Naples and Maeser. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 138 and 153. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 353 and 368. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
